required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brilinta Taiwan Post Approval Safety Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single Arm, Open Label, Phase IV Study to Evaluate Safety and to Describe the Cumulative Incidence of Major Cardiovascular Events of Ticagrelor in Taiwanese Patients With Non ST-segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter, single arm, open label, Phase IV study to evaluate safety and to describe the cumulative incidence of major cardiovascular events of Ticagrelor in Taiwanese patients with non ST-segment (a segment in the eletrocardiogram which presents the period when ventricles are depolarized) elevation myocardial infarction

detailed_description.textblock: This study will be conducted in approximately 8 investigational centres in Taiwan. It is expected that approximately 100 patients will be enrolled into study treatment. This study is to describe the safety and tolerability of ticagrelor, by assessment of the bleeding events and other serious adverse events (SAEs) during 1year follow up in Taiwanese non ST-elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI) patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during 1year follow up with ticagrelor treatment
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of PLATO (PLATelet inhibition and patient Outcomes)-defined fatal/life-threatening bleedings

primary_outcome.time_frame: during 1year follow up with ticagrelor treatment
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of PLATO (PLATelet inhibition and patient Outcomes)-defined major bleedings

primary_outcome.measure: The bleeding events (major and minor bleedings)
primary_outcome.time_frame: during 1year follow up with ticagrelor treatment
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of PLATO (PLATelet inhibition and patient Outcomes)-defined major + minor bleedings

primary_outcome.time_frame: during 1year follow up with ticagrelor treatment
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of serious adverse events other than bleedings

primary_outcome.time_frame: during 1year follow up with ticagrelor treatment
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of major cardiovascular events including cardiovascular death, myocardial infarction or stroke

arm_group.description: Ticagrelor 180mg loading dose taken orally, followed by 90mg twice daily (bd)

intervention.intervention_name: Ticagrelor 180mg loading dose taken orally, followed by 90mg twice daily (bd)
intervention.description: Ticagrelor 180mg loading dose taken orally, followed by 90mg twice daily (bd)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provision of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures
2. Female or male aged at least 20 years
3. Patient who is considered as ethnic Taiwanese
4. Index event of non-ST elevation myocardial infarction
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindication or other reason that ticagrelor should not be administered
2. Index event is an acute complication of Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI)
3. Patient has planned for an urgent coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) within 7 days from the enrolment
4. Oral anticoagulation therapy within 30 days prior to enrolment or cannot be stopped
5. Fibrinolytic therapy in the 24 hours prior to enrolment, or planned fibrinolytic treatment following enrolment
